guidelines.name: Accessibility
guidelines.description: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance, keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and focus management.
rules: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
Color contrast ratio must be at least 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text
All images must have descriptive alt text
Focus indicators must be visible and meet 3:1 contrast
ARIA labels must be provided for icon-only buttons
Form fields must have associated labels
Error messages must be programmatically associated with fields
Modals must trap focus and return focus on close

principles.name: Clarity
principles.description: Every element should have a clear purpose. Remove anything that doesn't help the user.

principles.name: Consistency
principles.description: Use the same patterns and tokens everywhere. Predictability reduces cognitive load.

principles.name: Efficiency
principles.description: Minimize steps to complete tasks. Respect the user's time.

principles.name: Inclusivity
principles.description: Design for all abilities, devices, and contexts.

principles.name: Delight
principles.description: Small moments of polish build trust. Motion and micro-interactions matter.

guidelines.name: Content Guidelines
guidelines.description: Voice, tone, microcopy standards, and writing style.
rules: Use sentence case for headings and labels
Button labels should be action verbs (Save, Delete, Submit)
Error messages should explain what went wrong and how to fix it
Placeholder text should be examples, not labels
Keep microcopy concise â€” under 20 words for toasts and tooltips
Use 'you' and 'your' to address the user directly
Avoid jargon and technical terms in user-facing copy

guidelines.name: Contributing
guidelines.description: How to propose new components, naming conventions, and file structure.
process: 1. Check if a similar component already exists
2. Propose the component with use cases and API design
3. Build using Radix primitives where possible
4. Include variants, sizes, and accessibility support
5. Add InstallBlock with install, import, and usage snippets
6. Document in the Storybook with ComponentSection examples

namingConventions.files: PascalCase for components (Button.tsx), kebab-case for utilities
